project_info.title: What We've Achieved: A Stable, Working Proof Layer

outline.title: What We've Achieved: A Stable, Working Proof Layer
outline.summary: Shared Spine: Celebrates the completion of Season 2 as a stable, working proof layer that is bounded and operational.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/7xzCR0XZPo9C.png - The title slide is about autonomous, Gmail-driven workflows. Image 9 is a clear diagram illustrating an email workflow automation system, which is highly relevant.

outline.title: Why Season 2 Is Free: Building Trust at Scale
outline.summary: Shared Spine: Explains that the free core builds trust and legitimacy, while packaging is where money enters.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/3IvV1ixBjeaR.jpg - This slide discusses the CI/CD Alert Router and reducing operational latency in CI/CD pipelines. Image 7 is a clear, professional diagram of the DevOps/CI/CD lifecycle, which provides excellent context.

outline.title: Governance & Control: Built for Growth
outline.summary: Shared Spine: Reassures that governance is in place with clear decision authority and drift prevention to scale safely.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/2GwMYaF87DIt.jpg - This slide details the architecture flow of the CI/CD Alert Router: Ingest -> Parse -> Route -> Action. Image 4 is a flow diagram showing a Service Activity Monitoring architecture with clear steps (Flow, Event Producer, Queue, Filter & Handler, Persistence Handler), which visually represents the routing and processing concept.

outline.title: What's Done vs. What's Next
outline.summary: Shared Spine: Clarifies that Season 2 is complete (closed) and Season 3 is ready to build (open), listing specific modules.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/eSV5nV8y12qx.jpg - This slide introduces the Evidence Snapshot Trigger and verifiable audit trails. Image 12 is a graphic explicitly titled "What is Audit Trail?" and visually represents the concept of data security, logs, and compliance.

outline.title: Entry Condition: Demand-Driven, Not Supply-Pushed
outline.summary: Shared Spine: Sets the condition that Season 3 starts with assessment and revenue is demand-driven.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/0jTOXJsqy56t.jpg - This slide focuses on cryptographic attestation and binding the email hash to the snapshot in an immutable ledger. Image 14 is a diagram related to cryptographically signed, tamper-proof audit logs, which directly supports the concept of verifiable and attested evidence.

outline.title: Season 3 Revenue: Bolt-On Modules & Licensing
outline.summary: Gordon (Commercial): Identifies bolt-on modules (CI/CD Router, Evidence Trigger) and target buyers for Season 3.
outline.image_plan: /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/EUPq23Zkohgk.png; /home/ubuntu/upload/search_images/z8uMpYMyv1vh.png - The final slide is about next steps and operational deployment, summarizing the impact (reducing latency, strengthening compliance). Images 1 and 2 are dashboards showing metrics, which visually represent the measurable impact and monitoring of the deployed systems (CI/CD metrics, application health).

outline.title: IP Monetisation: Licensing the Foundation
outline.summary: Gordon (Commercial): Projects licensing models for Season 1 & 2 IP and defines what will not be sold.
outline.image_plan: Use a suitable image if needed

outline.title: Operational Reality: Honest Assessment
outline.summary: Steven (Operational): Distinguishes production-ready components from those needing hardening, acknowledging known risks.

outline.title: Authority & Accountability: Defined Boundaries
outline.summary: Steven (Operational): Clarifies Steven's authority over operational calls and the boundary between support and management.

outline.title: Risk Profile: Survivable Failures, Real Optionality
outline.summary: John (Board): Explains realistic failure modes and why the free model makes failure survivable and success scalable.

outline.title: What Success Looks Like: Patient Capital
outline.summary: John (Board): Defines success as slow, correct adoption where reputation is valued over speed.
